functions package#

Submodules#

functions.common_functions module#

This module contains functions with logic which is commonly used across multiple modules: expenses.py, income.py, budget.py and goals.py.

functions.common_functions.amount_check(new_amount)[source]#

This function checks that a user input is valid for a monetary amount.

Parameters:

new_amount – amount entered by user

Returns:

True if valid or False if invalid

Return type:

bool

functions.common_functions.clear()[source]#

Clears terminal

Returns:

None

functions.common_functions.description_check(new_expense)[source]#

Checks validity of user input for a description for an expense or income.

Parameters:

new_expense – str description

Returns:

True if valid or False if invalid

Return type:

bool

functions.common_functions.get_amount()[source]#

This function gets an amount from the user

Returns:

new amount

Return type:

str

functions.common_functions.get_category_dict(category_list)[source]#

This function prints the existing categories for the user and returns a dictionary of number of category printed to user as values and the category primary key in ‘categories’ table as values.

Returns:

dictionary to get category id number

Return type:

dict

functions.common_functions.get_range_for_search(selection)[source]#

This function gets a range of values user selection for a number of months to search

Parameters:

selection – ‘2’, ‘3’ or ‘4’

Returns:

range to search

Return type:

range

functions.common_functions.get_rows_from_dates(date_range, table)[source]#

This function selects rows from a table which match the date range selected by user.

Parameters:

  • date_range – User selection: ‘1’, ‘2’, ‘3’, ‘4’ or ‘5’

  • table – str table name in database

Returns:

rows from table which match date range

Return type:

list of tuples

functions.common_functions.get_term(string)[source]#

This function returns a term from a user choice

Parameters:

string – ‘1’, ‘2’, ‘3’ or ‘0’

Returns:

‘weekly’, ‘monthly’, ‘annual’ or None

Return type:

str or None

functions.common_functions.money_format(some_amount)[source]#

This function convert an amount of money into a string with £ sign and 2 decimal places.

Returns:

amount with £ and 2 dp

Return type:

str

functions.common_functions.print_categories(category_list)[source]#

This function prints expense categories or income sources

Parameters:

category_list – list of categories

Returns:

None

functions.common_functions.select_category(table)[source]#

This function gets an id number from a table from its description.

Parameters:

table – str table name in database

Returns:

id number

Return type:

int

functions.common_functions.select_date_range()[source]#

This function gets a date range selection from user

Returns:

‘1’, ‘2’, ‘3’, ‘4’, ‘5’, or ‘0’

Return type:

str

functions.common_functions.select_months(time_period)[source]#

This function gets the month and year in the format YYYY-MM for each month in the specified time period.

Parameters:

time_period – integer range

Returns:

previous months in specified range

Return type:

list

functions.date_functions module#

This module contains functions with the logic for finding date ranges from user input.

References

[1] Tutorials Point (for function get_week_dates) https://www.tutorialspoint.com/How-to-find-only-Monday-s-date-with-Python#:~:text=the%20dateutil%20module.-,Use%20the%20today()%20function%20(gets%20the%20current%20local%20date,Print%20the%20last%20Monday%20date. # noqa

functions.date_functions.all_dates_in_week(date)[source]#

This function takes in a date and returns that date plus the next six days.

Parameters:

date – a date

Returns:

dates for week

Return type:

list of dates

functions.date_functions.get_date_of_first_day_each_week_this_year()[source]#

This function gets the first day of each week in the current year starting from 1st Jan up until today’s date.

Returns:

list of first day of week for this year

Return type:

list of str

functions.date_functions.get_dates(first_day, days_list)[source]#

This function gets dates for days that have passed since a given day and appends them to a list of days

Parameters:

first_day – day in the past

Returns:

list of days since first_day

Return type:

list of str

functions.date_functions.get_dates_for_goals()[source]#

This function gets user selection for term and calls relevant function

Returns:

None

functions.date_functions.get_days_list(term)[source]#

This function gets a list of days over a given term

Parameters:

term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

list of dates

Return type:

list of str

functions.date_functions.get_month_dates()[source]#

This function finds the first day of the current month, appends it to a list. It then returns function to get dates for previous months

Returns:

returns function to get dates for previous months

Return type:

func

functions.date_functions.get_week_dates()[source]#

This function gets last Monday’s date, makes a new list and appends last Monday. It then calls function to get dates before last Monday

Returns:

function to get dates before last Monday

Return type:

func

functions.date_functions.get_year_dates()[source]#

This function gets the first day of this year and returns function to get days between then and now

Returns:

function to get a list of days since start of year

Return type:

func
